name: Candlelight Inn

reviews.title: Fabulous B&B
reviews.text: Our first time in Napa and first B&B experience were fabulous. My husband and I had not been away without the kids in nearly nine years. From the moment we arrived, Sam and the rest of the staff made us feel incredibly welcome in our home away from home. We were given a tour of the premises, including the pool, patio and the dining room (with snacks!). Sam was always ready with recommendations including restaurants, wineries and where to pick up odds and ends. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable - before we checked out I had to find out what kind of mattress we had because it had been soooo long since I slept that well!! (After Napa we stayed at a hotel in Sonoma and did not sleep nearly as good), Breakfast was delicious everyday (loved the croissant french toast) and enjoyed a cheese plate while soaking in the jacuzzi tub.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we decided to spend our first wedding anniversary in Napa, my husband and I searched long and hard for a place to stay. We turned up negative reviews for every single one...except The Candlelight Inn. When the website showed only one room available for the dates we wanted, I called directly and, at 10 o'clock at night California time, Wendy answered pleasantly and got us all set up. Little did I know this was only the tip of the iceberg in terms of the wonderful things awaiting us there.
reviews.title: Paradise in Napa

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at The Candlelight Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the good stuff others on here are saying is true -- the breakfasts are beyond delicious, the location is convenient but secluded, the rooms and pool area are nothing short of idyllic, and every photo on their website shows what the place truly looks like. I was worried that our room, which looked out onto the parking lot, would get a lot of outside noise or not feel as private, but it turned out to be amazing. Oh, and for what it's worth, my husband is allergic to cats, but the presence of Fluffy around the house was never a problem for him. In fact, hubby welcomed him in when he followed us back to our room one night!
reviews.title: First time ever at a B&B

likes.liked: — I can't pick just one thing, I loved it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at The Candlelight Inn. I only have good things to say. The Inn is so quaint and elegant. As you approach you see that the grounds are well kept, and once inside you will notice how impeccably decorated and immaculately clean all of the rooms are. Our room was spacious, well appointed with jacuzzi, fireplace, four poster bed, nightstand with fresh flowers, lovely linens, and plush towels and robes. It was truly home away from home. The bath was spacious, and CLEAN. I mean CLEAN. I can not overstate HOW AMAZING BREAKFAST WAS each morning. Three courses, expertly prepared and presented. I can still taste the most delicious raisin bread french toast with vanilla cream sauce...oh my! We were taken very well care of by our Host - Sam and staff. He was very knowledgable and a pleasure to see every morning. He respected our privacy, but was there in a snap if we needed. He runs a wonderful gem of a B&B. I highly recommend this Inn as a lovely place to stay when visiting the Napa Valley. It is centrally located right off Rt 29 and the Silverado Trail. Easy access to all in the area. Parking, Internet, the works. Thank you Sam and Staff for a lovely stay. It was such a treat to be spoiled for a few days!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay!

reviews.title: Wineing and dining and sleeping in Napa at the Candlelight Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to Napa for our honeymoon. We had wanted to get one of the rooms inside the Inn but the one we wanted was booked. After doing some more research, we found out the Inn has a cottage on the back of the property that is not advertised. We ended up getting that for our stay and it was wonderful. It is secluded but still very close to the pool and the main building. The inside was gorgeous with the kitchen area to the bedroom and the deck out back. Breakfasts were wonderful and Wendy would even bring them out to us every morning. Sometimes the Candlelight Inn cat, Fluffy, would even stop by for a visit while we were enjoying our breakfast. Wendy and Sam were both very helpful with any questions we had about what to do or where to eat. The Inn is very close to all roads and yet it is also off on its' own. It is an interesting contrast. I couldn't recommend the Candlelight Inn more highly. We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: We didn't want to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Candlelight during our honeymoon, and dearly wish we had planned to stay longer. We have stayed at several B&Bs and can honestly say that the Candlelight is by far the best! The house is elegant without being pretentious, the rooms are beautiful and comfortable, and the grounds are stunning. There is a wonderful pool in the back, complete with a poolhouse stocked with big, fluffy towels. The breakfast is first-class, and Wendy and Sam are so very nice and unbelievably helpful! We have told everyone we know to stay at the Candlelight whenever they visit Napa, and you should too. You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: A Perfect B&B Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This beautiful property is just outside of dowtown Napa and at the end of a very quiet residential street. It is only a minute to Hwy 29 and very convenient to downtown and other Napa restaurants. While our room was on the small side, it was very nicely furnished with a great bed and a beautiful view. The quality of the breakfast was outstanding and the people who run this place are great. It is a great place to base your wine tours and the pool is a nice place to come back to and relax after a long day.

They helped us with reservations, recommendations on wineries to visit and other services with enthusiasm and great energy.

description: Inns and Hotels are places we escape to in order to rejuvenate and re-define ourselves. As our home away from home we look to them for nurturing. As our base for new adventures we look within their walls for inspiration. Ideally situated on the border of Sonoma and Napa at the gateway between the Bay Area and Wine Country, the Candlelight Inn’s bucolic surroundings have been providing a charming and romantic backdrop since 1929.It’s rustic and secluded charm boasts an historic Tudor building of whitewashed plaster set between blackened oak timbers cozily situated under the shade of its own Redwood grove on a tributary of the Napa River. The Candlelight Inn can be as public or private as you’d like. As a romantic getaway you’ll find its quiet seclusion an inspiration for opening yourself to intimate moments. As a collaborator in providing world-class dining and touring experiences, Candlelight Inn proves the perfect ally.Whether soaking up sunshine by the pool or hiking the nearby hills, you’ll know that you are in one of California’s most prized destinations.Aware of its history, but not enraptured by it, the Candlelight Inn Napa Valley is a reflection of the rich cultural history of Wine Country and a hub of all the diverse and evolving landscapes around it. After a day enjoying the bounty of the surrounding environs, or at the end of a long evening spent ruminating around the dinner table, Candlelight Inn serves as the ideal space to transition or expand your mood. By Joseph Mora C.W.P.
